derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, from late Latin cyclus, from Greek kuklos 'circle'

entry.def: If you cycle, you ride a bicycle.

example.ex: Britain could save £4.6 billion a year in road transport costs if more people cycled...
example.tran: 如更多的人骑自行车，英国一年能在道路交通上节省46亿英镑的开销。

entry.def: A cycle is a series of events or processes that is repeated again and again, always in the same order.

example.ex: The figures marked the final low point of the present economic cycle...
example.tran: 这些数据显示了目前经济周期的最低点。

entry.tran: (运转的)一周，一圈;一个工作循环
entry.def: A cycle is a single complete series of movements in an electrical, electronic, or mechanical process.
A cycle is a series of songs or poems that are intended to be performed or read one after the other.

means.word_mean: 1. an interval during which a recurring sequence of events occurs;
2. a series of poems or songs on the same theme;
3. a periodically repeated sequence of events;
4. the unit of frequency; one Hertz has a periodic interval of one second
5. a single complete execution of a periodically repeated phenomenon;

sentences.sentence: "a year constitutes a cycle of the seasons"

means.word_mean: 6. a wheeled vehicle that has two wheels and is moved by foot pedals
1. cause to go through a recurring sequence;

sentences.sentence: "cycle thge laundry in this washing program"

Sentence.sentence: The last generation of the season about the forth may make the journey back in Mexico and restart the cycle.
Each generation in a cycle lays eggs at a different place
Runaway fires pour even more carbon into the air, which increases temperatures, starting the whole vicious cycle all over again.

jushi.english: The seasons of the year—spring, summer, autumn and winter—make a cycle.
jushi.chinese: 一年春夏秋冬四季构成一个循环。
